abstract_summ: Only in the first two decades of the 21st Century, the world has witnessed the epidemics of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndromes, Zika virus, Ebola virus, Yellow Fever, the new COVID-19, besides the traditional influenza and other virus and bacteria.This virus is the same member of the coronavirus family that caused the severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS-CoV) reported in China 2003, and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS-CoV) reported in Saudi Arabia in 2012.In this review article there are the various recent cases of the patients that are suffering from the corona virus, the outcome of these studies is that corona virus infection is an epidemic disease which affects Central Nervous System (CNS).In December 2019, the pneumonia epidemic that occurred due to an unknown reason in Wuhan, China, has spread to the whole country.This began as an outbreak in December 2019, and till February 28, 2020, there have been 83,704 confirmed cases of novel coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) globally, with 2,859 deaths, resulting in an overall case fatality rate of 3.41 per cent (95% confidence interval 3.29-3.54%).While the information available on this newly identified virus is limited and evolving, here is a quick run-down of what has been figured out so far.“SARS-CoV2”, a previously unknown strain of coronaviruses caused a severe respiratory disease called Coronavirus disease (COVID-19) which emerged from Wuhan city of China on 30 December 2019, and declared as Global health problem by World Health Organisation within a month.
title_summ: Detecting the Coronavirus (COVID-19).COVID-19, una emergencia de salud pública mundialNovel Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19)COVID-19 diagnostic approaches: different roads to the same destinationCOVID-19, a worldwide public health emergencyCharacteristics of and Public Health Responses to the Coronavirus Disease 2019 Outbreak in ChinaArt of prevention: Life in the time of coronavirus()()()Coronavirus nCOVID-19: A Pandemic Disease and the Saudi precautionsRecent apprise on coronavirus and its terrible insinuations2019 Coronavirus Disease Applications Made During an Outbreak in a Chemotherapy Center:The Case of TurkeyEpidemiological analysis of COVID‐19 and practical experience from ChinaGAIA 3.0: Effects of the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) outbreak on sustainable development and future perspectives.Hantavirus Infection and the Renal SyndromeThe 2019 novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) pandemic: A review of the current evidence.The novel zoonotic COVID-19 pandemic: An expected global health concern.Coronavirus Disease 2019 outbreak: preparedness and readiness of countries in the Eastern Mediterranean Region.
title_abstract_phrases: Only in the first two decades of the 21st Century, the world has witnessed the epidemics of Severe Acute Respiratory Syndromes, Zika virus, Ebola virus, Yellow Fever, the new COVID-19, besides the traditional influenza and other virus and bacteria.This virus is the same member of the coronavirus family that caused the severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS-CoV) reported in China 2003, and Middle East respiratory syndrome (MERS-CoV) reported in Saudi Arabia in 2012.In this review article there are the various recent cases of the patients that are suffering from the corona virus, the outcome of these studies is that corona virus infection is an epidemic disease which affects Central Nervous System (CNS).2019 Coronavirus Disease Applications Made During an Outbreak in a Chemotherapy Center: The Case of TurkeyIn December 2019, the pneumonia epidemic that occurred due to an unknown reason in Wuhan, China, has spread to the whole country.This family of viruses is responsible for the common cold along with the infamous severe acute respiratory syndrome epidemic in 2002 and Middle East respiratory syndrome in 2012.This disease was originally named the new coronavirus (2019-nCoV), then the World Health Organization (WHO) changed this epidemic disease to Corona Virus Disease (COVID-19) on February 11, 2020.
